items.title: yanc dies while using TestId plugin and verbose output
items.body:
nosetests --with-yanc --with-id --collect-only -v test.py

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.8_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nose-1.3.4-py2.7.egg/nose/case.py", line 133, in run
    self.runTest(result)
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.8_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nose-1.3.4-py2.7.egg/nose/case.py", line 151, in runTest
    test(result)
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.8_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/unittest/case.py", line 393, in __call__
    return self.run(*args, **kwds)
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.8_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/unittest/case.py", line 304, in run
    result.startTest(self)
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.8_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nose-1.3.4-py2.7.egg/nose/proxy.py", line 169, in startTest
    self.plugins.startTest(self.test)
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.8_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nose-1.3.4-py2.7.egg/nose/plugins/manager.py", line 99, in __call__
    return self.call(*arg, **kw)
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.8_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nose-1.3.4-py2.7.egg/nose/plugins/manager.py", line 167, in simple
    result = meth(*arg, **kw)
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.8_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nose-1.3.4-py2.7.egg/nose/plugins/testid.py", line 272, in startTest
    self.write('#%s ' % self.tests[adr])
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.8_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nose-1.3.4-py2.7.egg/nose/plugins/testid.py", line 306, in write
    self.stream.write(output)
AttributeError: 'TestId' object has no attribute 'stream'
```

items.title: yanc 0.3.2 regression
items.body:
Something broke while running nose tests (with multiprocessing) using yanc 0.3.2:

```
Running generic unittests
Process Process-2:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/process.py", line 258, in _bootstrap
    self.run()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/process.py", line 114, in run
    self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
  File "/var/lib/jenkins/shiningpanda/jobs/af42804d/virtualenvs/d41d8cd9/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nose/plugins/multiprocess.py", line 652, in runner
    keyboardCaught, shouldStop, loaderClass, resultClass, config)
  File "/var/lib/jenkins/shiningpanda/jobs/af42804d/virtualenvs/d41d8cd9/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nose/plugins/multiprocess.py", line 661, in __runner
    config = pickle.loads(config)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/pickle.py", line 1382, in loads
    return Unpickler(file).load()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/pickle.py", line 858, in load
    dispatch[key](self)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/pickle.py", line 1217, in load_build
    setstate(state)
  File "/var/lib/jenkins/shiningpanda/jobs/af42804d/virtualenvs/d41d8cd9/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nose/config.py", line 244, in __setstate__
    self.plugins.configure(self.options, self)
  File "/var/lib/jenkins/shiningpanda/jobs/af42804d/virtualenvs/d41d8cd9/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nose/plugins/manager.py", line 284, in configure
    cfg(options, config)
  File "/var/lib/jenkins/shiningpanda/jobs/af42804d/virtualenvs/d41d8cd9/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nose/plugins/manager.py", line 99, in __call__
    return self.call(*arg, **kw)
  File "/var/lib/jenkins/shiningpanda/jobs/af42804d/virtualenvs/d41d8cd9/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nose/plugins/manager.py", line 167, in simple
    result = meth(*arg, **kw)
  File "/var/lib/jenkins/shiningpanda/jobs/af42804d/virtualenvs/d41d8cd9/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/yanc/yancplugin.py", line 40, in configure
    and hasattr(conf.stream, "isatty") and conf.stream.isatty():
AttributeError: 'Config' object has no attribute 'stream'
```

Reverting back to yanc 0.3.1 solved the issue.

items.title: Colouring broken with --processes
items.body:
When running tests in parallel, it seems that the results are only coloured once for each worker. A picture probably shows this better:

![screenshot from 2014-06-29 12 31 11](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/70800/3423107/fa9cfd3c-ff80-11e3-8e58-232aefb35e5a.png)

Note there are four green dots on the second test run.

items.title: No documentation regarding enabling the plugin in config files .noserc
items.body:
#1 There is no info regarding how to run with this plugin enabled. Please add `nosetests --with-yanc` to the README.
#2 I tried to enable the plugin by adding it to the .noserc file but it does not enable it.

[nosetests]
verbosity=2
with-doctest=1

Also this should be documented. And last but not least Thanks!

items.title: Coloring not working Windows
items.body:
I was not able to get coloring to work under Windows. 

termcolor does not work, under windows you need a separate solution.

You can find a working example at https://github.com/ssbarnea/tendo/blob/master/tendo/colorer.py
